Source Sample GUID.1: List the sample's Globally Unique Identifier, if available. More details are available on the "instructions" tab.

Sample Name*.1: Give the sample a name that is meaningful to you. Sample names must be unique across all JGI projects and contain ASCII characters only.

Biological replicate/sample group Name*.1: Samples that are biological replicates should have the same group name.  If your project does not contain biological replicates, give each sample its own group name.

Isotope Label* (required for Stable Isot.1: Choose from the following: C13, N15, O18, Unlabeled

Concentration* (ng/ul).1: Must be calculated using a fluorometric method; value >0 and <2000.

Volume* (ul).1: Value must be >0 and <1000 (values <25 by special permission only).

Tube or Plate Label*.1: Must be unique across all tubes and plates, and <20 characters. All samples in a plate should have the same plate label.

Plate location (well #)* required if sam.1: Corner wells must be blank. For partial plates, fill by columns. Leave blank if the sample will be shipped in a tube.

Sample Format*.1: Choose from the following: Pellet, RNAStable, DNAStable, Ethanol, MDA reaction buffer, PBS, TE, Water, Low EDTA TE, 10 mM Tris-HCl, Gentegra-DNA

Was Sample DNAse treated?*.1: Y/N.  Note DNAse treatment is required for all RNA samples.

Known / Suspected Organisms.1: List any organisms known or suspected to grow in co-culture, as well as estimated % of the organism in that culture.

Sample Isolation Method*.1: Describe the method/protocol/kit used to extract DNA/RNA.

Collection Year*.1: Year in which the sample was collected.

Collection Month*.1: Month in which the sample was collected. Use the full name of the month.

Collection Day*.1: Day on which the sample was collected.

Collection Site or Growth Conditions* (r.1: Provide information on the specific tissue type or growth conditions.

Latitude*.1: Latitude of sample collection. Value must be numeric only and between -90 and 90.

Longitude*.1: Longitude of sample collection. Value must be numeric only and between -180 and 180.

Depth* (in meters) or minimum depth if a.1: Depth below the surface. If the sample was collected from a range of depths, indicate the shallowest depth. Value must be numeric and 0 or greater.

Maximum depth (in meters) if a range.1: If the sample was collected from a range of depths, indicate the maximum depth below the surface. Value must be numeric and >0.

Elevation* (in meters) or minimum elevat.1: Elevation (from sea level) of sample collection. If the sample was collected from a range of elevations, indicate the elevation nearest to sea level.Value must be numeric and can be either positive or negative.

Maximum elevation (in meters) if a range.1: If the sample was collected from a range of elevations, indicate the elevation farthest from sea level. Value must be numeric and can be either positive or negative.

Country*.1: Country or ocean where the sample was collected.
